snippet: In Ciudad Juárez, one of the deadliest cities in the world, the Indios were a miracle, winning their way to the first division of Mexican soccer. But the miracle didn’t last.
abstract: Indios soccer team once brought hope to Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, one of the world's deadliest cities, winning its way to the top echelon of Mexican soccer in 2008, even as the city was descending into horrific violence; the miracle did not last, however, as the team is now defunct and bloodshed holds sway in the border city.
lead_paragraph: In Ciudad Juárez, one of the deadliest cities in the world, the Indios were a miracle, winning their way to the first division of Mexican soccer. But the miracle didn’t last.

headline.seo: Team of Hope, Gone in City of Violence
headline.main: Team of Hope, Gone in City of Violence
headline.print_headline: Team of Hope, Gone In City of Violence
